snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include price estimates on Google’s superfast broadband project, a study that says people are still using cellphones...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include price estimates on Google’s superfast broadband project, a study that says people are still using cellphones while driving despite laws against it, and Advanced Micro Devices saying the rate at which computing power grows is slowing.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Private Maps and Google Glass Ban
